intro: Schuurmansia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed schuurmansia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically red or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Schuurmansia angustifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant.
